sentences: Stefano Arteaga (born Esteban de Arteaga y LÃ³pez; December 26, 1747 - September 30, 1799) was a Spanish-born writer on theater and music, active in Italy.
Arteaga was a young man, already a Jesuit priest, when the suppression of the order in Spain, forced him into exile.
A second edition, in three volumes, appeared at Venice in 1785. He also left behind him a manuscript treatise on the rhythm of the ancients.
